quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, widow, didnt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who recorded the 1960s classic rock song House of the Rising Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Animals

questions.question: Which band or artist recorded the 1970s classic rock song Stranglehold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Nugent

questions.question: Which band or artist recorded the 1960s classic rock song Whole Lotta Love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin

questions.question: Who recorded the 1970s classic rock song Sweet Home Alabama?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynyrd Skynyrd

questions.question: The first entry on Rolling Stone Magazines Top 500 Songs for The Beatles was in the # 8 position. This song was the best selling Beatles song in the U.S. and also the longest. What Beatles song held the # 1 position on the pop charts for nine weeks in 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hey, Jude

questions.question: Which of these bands or artists has not performed a cover of American Pie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willie Nelson

questions.question: So if you meet me
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sympathy For the Devil

questions.question: The amusement park rises bold and stark

options.text: Die Young Leave a Beautiful Corpse
Too Young to Die, Too Old to Live

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Born to Run

questions.question: Whose widow was the author of the song American Pie referring to with the line, When I read about his widowed bride?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddy Holly

questions.question: Which band released the 1990s classic rock song Man in the Box?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alice in Chains

questions.question: In what year was the song American Pie recorded and released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1971

questions.question: Which band or artist recorded the 1970s song Suffragette City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: Pasty Cline didnt like the demo and when she heard the title of the song was Crazy , she replied, It sure is. But the lush arrangement and the backup vocals of the Jordanaires helped this song reach the top ten in 1961. Who was the beginning songwriter that wrote Crazy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willie Nelson

questions.question: Which band or artist recorded the 1980s hit rock song Were Not Gonna Take It?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Twisted Sister

questions.question: What artist sang the original version of American Pie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don McLean

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, virtuoso, steve. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Through most of his career Brian May of Queen has primarily used the same exact guitar called Red Special.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: She died at the age of 30 in 1963, but not before creating some of the most influential country music hits including:  Walking After Midnight, I Fall to Pieces and Crazy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patsy Cline

questions.question: Which band recorded the 1990s rock song Smells Like Teen Spirit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nirvana

questions.question: Which guitarist ran for the Presidency of the United States in 1980?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Walsh

questions.question: She has issued 29 albums and had over 60 million records sold as of 2006.  She is regarded as the Queen of Country Music and did a remake of the Vickie Lawrence tune The Night the Lights Went Out in Georgia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reba McIntrye

questions.question: This Alabama native was labeled the first country music superstar, performing hits like Im So Lonesome, I Could Cry and Your Cheatin Heart.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Williams, Sr.

questions.question: Who released the 1980s classic rock song Sweet Child of Mine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guns n Roses

questions.question: The Jimi Hendrix Experience played a historic set at the Monterey Pop Festival in the summer of 1967. Which music legend recommended the Experience to the organizers of the festival?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: Born in 1929 in Sherman, Texas, he had twenty plus #1 hits with his band the Buckaroos (so named by his friend, Merle Haggard).  One of his more noted songs was Tiger By the Tail.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buck Owens

questions.question: Which of these influential guitarists did NOT die in an aviation accident?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Clark

questions.question: Who recorded the 1970s hit song Rock  Roll Hoochie Koo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick Derringer

questions.question: Which of these is the name of one of Eric Claptons famous guitars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brownie

questions.question: Which guitar god played the solo on Michael Jacksons hit song Beat It?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Van Halen

questions.question: Virtuoso Steve Vai has been featured on albums by all but one of these bands/artists. For which of these hasnt he performed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzy Osbourne

questions.question: Which of these guitarists was NOT in the Yardbirds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jeff Skunk Baxter

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lyrics and Group
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, horton, frankie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The following verses are from a ballad about what famous frontiersman:

options.text: rn on a mountain top in Tennessee, greenest state in the land of the free.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Davy Crockett

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of this historical ballad:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bat Masterson

questions.question: Gunfight at the OK Corral was sung by Frankie Laine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from a historical ballad of 1960:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bismark

questions.question: Public Enemy, the first rap group on the list of Immortals published by Rolling Stone Magazine, won the 44th position.  What song from Public Enemys album Fear of a Black Planet  was used in Spike Lees movie Do the Right Thing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fight the Power

questions.question: Who sang this historical ballad:

options.text: g Sam left Seattle in the year of 92, with George Craft his partner and Brother Billy,

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Horton

questions.question: We get no shelter when it rains. All we got is Yankee brains is part of the lyrics from the ballad Swamp Fox.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What a ________what a doer, what a dream come a truer was he.  This line is about which
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Boone

questions.question: Perhaps the lead singer of this rock and roll band regrets saying Id rather be dead than singing Satisfaction  when I am forty five. This group known as the  Worlds Greatest Rock and Roll Band is ranked in the # 4 position in the Rolling Stone Magazines list of Immortals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: The group at # 50 on Rolling Stone Magazines list of Immortals was the backup band for Bob Dylan when Dylan plugged up his guitar and shocked the folk purist at the 1965 Newport Folk Festival. Their first album  Music from Big Pink  included the songs The Weight and I Shall be Released. Can you name this group that starred in Martin Scorsese film, The Last Waltz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Band

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from a song performed by Johny Horton:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Orleans

questions.question: What Aberdeen, Washington group, in position # 27 on the list of Immortals of Rock and Roll music, wrote the grunge anthem Smells Like Teen Spirit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nirvana

questions.question: Wyclef Jean wrote that the Immortal in the # 11 position on Rolling Stone Magazines list, almost single-handedly brought reggae to the world. What reggae Legend recorded No Woman No Cry, One Love, and Redemption Song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Marley

questions.question: The following lyrics were dedicated to a real historical figure:

options.text: sey Jones, steaming and a rolling. Casey Jones, you never have to guess.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The following lines are from a ballad dedicated to what famous frontier marshall:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wyatt Earp

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Songs
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, alternative, acclaim. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: These three guys, who were all former members of the group New Edition, released an album  called Poison in 1990. What is the name of their band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bell, Biv, DeVoe

questions.question: Michael Stipe and other musicians of similar tastes formed this band in 1980 at the University of Georgia. Throughout the 80s this band enjoyed primarily college radio success only to hit mainstream at the end of the decade with songs like The One I Love and Losing My Religion. [sound clip: Pop Song 89]
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: R.E.M

questions.question: This band was instrumental in paving the way for the massive alternative boom of the 90s ushed in by Nirvana. Members Black Francis, Joey Santiago, and Kim Deal enjoyed substantial success in Europe, but little chart action in the US. Notable songs include Where is My Mind?, Wave of Mutilation, and Here Comes Your Man [sound clip].
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pixies

questions.question: This innovative post-punk group, which includes former Sex Pistol John Lydon and a former guitarist from the Clash, produced songs such as Rise, Disappointed and This is Not a Love Song [sound clip].
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Public Image Ltd.

questions.question: Under the Milky Way has been considered one of the best songs to come out of Australia. The band, that recorded it, however, never achieved great commercial success partially due to their more progressive sound. Other notable songs include Metropolis and Reptile [sound clip].
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Church

questions.question: What is the name of this band from the 70s that had a #1 hit in the U.S. with Saturday Night?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bay City Rollers

questions.question: What name is Garth Brooks also known by?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Gaines

questions.question: Formed in 1982 and fronted by singer Chuck Mosely, this group produced a minor alternative hit called We Care a Lot (1987). But it was Moselys replacement, Mike Patton, who launched them into real commercial success in 1989 with the album The Real Thing which contained the songs Epic [sound clip] and Falling to Pieces.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faith No More

questions.question: What is the name of this B band from the 80s that wanted to fight for their right to party  in 1986?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beastie Boys

questions.question: This alternative English group has achieved critical acclaim but little in the way of chart success. With frontman Matt Johnson, the group released the notable songs This is the Day and Dogs of Lust [sound clip].
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The The

questions.question: The  name  Bee Gees stands for Brothers Gibb.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Where was Garth Brooks born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oklahoma

questions.question: What is the name of this Canadian B band from the 70s that was Taking Care of Business?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bachman Turner Overdrive

questions.question: What is the name of this RB B band from the 70s that had a huge hit, titled Sideshow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Magic

questions.question: This band had 3 huge hits in the 70s, one of them being Come and Get It.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Badfinger

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Album and Garth Brooks
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, harris, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On which Garth Brooks album can you find the song Friends in Low Places?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Fences

questions.question: The song We Shall Be Free can be found on the album The Chase.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the name of Garth Brooks third album released in September 1991?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ropin the Wind

questions.question: Which Patsy Cline song did Garth Brooks cover in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walking After Midnight

questions.question: Shania Twain cut two versions of her song Party for Two.  One she recorded with country singer Billy Currington. The rocking version was made with the lead singer of Shrinky Dinx
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark McGrath

questions.question: Country singer Tim McGraw was featured in which rappers number one Billboard hit, Over and Over?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nelly

questions.question: Which of these songs was written as a tribute to Garth Brooks good friend, country artist, Chris LeDoux, after his death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good Ride Cowboy

questions.question: Johnnie Cash garnered six MTV nominations with his remake of this heavy metal groups song, Hurt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nine Inch Nails

questions.question: You Make Me Feel Like Dancing was a huge dance hit for this singer in the year 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leo Sayer

questions.question: Dolly Parton and Emmylou Harris cut the album Trio with this former lead singer of the Stone Poneys.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Linda Ronstadt

questions.question: In what year did Garth Brooks marry long-time friend, girlfriend, and country artist Trisha Yearwood?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2005

questions.question: What was the name of Garth Brooks first album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garth Brooks

questions.question: In which of Garth Brooks music videos can we see Lane Frost, Martin, Luther King Jr. and Keith Whitley?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dance

questions.question: Both Carl Perkins and this rock n roll star recorded for the famed Sun Records, both are in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, both had hits with the song that Perkins wrote after hearing a conversation on a dance floor but its the rock n roll stars hit that most people connect to this 1956 Top Ten pick.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elvis Presley

questions.question: A former Rhodes Scholar and Golden Gloves Boxer, this country music outlaw penned Me and Bobby McGee which became a number one single for his former girlfriend, Janis Joplin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kris Kristofferson

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, disneys, reflections. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Disney character would NOT be whistling this song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abu

questions.question: They were the first Scottish group to ever top the UK chart.  Their song Reflections Of My Life (1969) made the U.S. top 10.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marmalade

questions.question: For whether we are white of copper skinned
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pocahontas

questions.question: The following lyrics are taken from Oliver and Company:

options.text: t when all the world says Yes
nt ask a mutt to strut like a show girl, darling

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bette Midler

questions.question: The Rolling Stones Rock and Roll Circus was a 1968 film containing performances by John Lennon, Jethro Tull, The Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, and this group who stole the show with their amazing performance of the song, A Quick One (featured in the audio clip).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Who

questions.question: They couldve been contenders.  This group has gained a reputation as one of the great lost missing links of 60s rock: massive talent unaccountably caught in a dead-end.  The most successful UK indie record label of the 90s takes its name from this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Creation

questions.question: Whitney Houston sang I Will Always Love You” for the soundtrack of The Bodyguard which became the third largest selling single in the world. The songwriter and singer of I Will Always Love You had her own number one with this song on the Country charts in 1974. What is the name of the original songwriter and singer of the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolly Parton

questions.question: Disneys first live action movie, Song of the South, was based on the stories of Uncle Remus by Joel Chandler Harris. What is the title of the song with the following lyrics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zip-A-Dee-Doo-Dah

questions.question: Which member of The Monkees sings lead on the 1967 hit A Little Bit Me, A Little Bit You?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Davy Jones

questions.question: Which of the following guitarists was never a member of The Yardbirds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ritchie Blackmore

questions.question: Although hardly remembered in the U.S., this band was one of the most influential bands to come out of the British Invasion.  Their record S. F. Sorrow is arguably the first rock opera, and their 1970 album Parachute was named Rolling Stone Magazines Album of the Year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pretty Things

questions.question: This heroine is perhaps the most feminist of Disneys female characters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mulan

questions.question: What is the name of the song by The Animals featured in the audio clip?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its My Life

questions.question: Needles and Pins was a recording by what band from Liverpool?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Searchers

questions.question: Which band recorded the song featured in the audio clip, a track from their critically acclaimed album, Odessey and Oracle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Zombies
